text: Baccharis bigelovii is a North American species of shrubs in the aster family known by the common name Bigelow's false willow . It is found in the Chihuahuan Desert and nearby regions of the United States and Mexico, in the States of Chihuahua, Durango, Sonora, Arizona, New Mexico, and Texas.Flora of North America, Bigelow’s false willow, Baccharis bigelovii A. Gray in W. H. Emory, Rep. U.S. Mex. Bound. 2(1): 84. 1859. Baccharis bigelovii is a shrub up to 100 cm (40 inches) tall, branching from the base. It produces many small flower heads. The plant grows on rocky ground in coniferous forests. ==References== ==External links== *Jepson Manual Treatment bigelovii Category:Plants described in 1859 Category:Flora of the South-Central United States Category:Flora of the Southwestern United States Category:Flora of Northwestern Mexico Category:Flora of Northeastern Mexico
